page.title: 07Whitchurch Village School
page.content: Whitchurch County Primary school is situated on the main A39 Wells Road about 4 miles from the centre of Bristol. It was opened in 1911 as a small village school. The early school log book tells for instance of the many absences from the school particularly at Harvest time and of how the schoolchildren entertained the local wounded troops from the Great War 1914-1918.In the 1930's extra classrooms and a large hall was built on to the existing stone building to cater for the growing local population.In 1944 the children on roll was 207 and in 1984 214.Until 1974 the school was maintained by Somerset County Council and now by Avon Education Authority.
